intro: Cephaelis leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered celandine, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its most striking feature is its clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
